name: Vijaya
shortDescription: The Bow of Karna - Invincible Weapon of the Sun's Son
fullDescription:
The Bow of Karna - Invincible Weapon of the Sun's Son Vijaya (Sanskrit: "Victory") stands as one of the two supreme celestial bows in Hindu epic
                    literature, the divine counterpart and equal to Arjuna's Gandiva. This legendary weapon was
                    wielded by Karna, the tragic hero of the Mahabharata - born to Kunti and the Sun God Surya
                    but abandoned at birth and raised as a charioteer's son. Vijaya represented Karna's claim
                    to divine favor despite his outcast status.
